pages.text:
Discover America's First Law Enforcement Museum
Buy Ticket
Our Story
A Legacy Begins
Founded by retired Police Chief Gerald Arenberg, the American Police Hall of Fame becomes the nation's first law enforcement museum.
Reaching the Community
A foundation is established to support law enforcement and the community.
Expanding Support
Two programs are founded to aid families of fallen officers and provide assistance to those injured in the line of duty.
Moving Forward
The museum relocates to Miami, Florida, continuing its mission to educate and honor law enforcement professionals.
A Permanent Home
The museum finds its forever home in Titusville, Florida, welcoming visitors to explore its exhibits and learn its stories.
Supporting Families
USLEF leads in providing vital resources, financial aid, and emotional support to the families of fallen officers and those disabled in the line of duty.
Shaping the Future
With innovative training and education programs, USLEF prepares future officers and citizens to uphold safety and justice.
1960
1967
1989
1990
2003
Today
Tomorrow
Inside the Museum
The American Police Hall of Fame Museum is a place to learn, explore and celebrate law enforcement for all the family! Through exciting exhibits, historic artifacts and fun, interactive activities, you will gain a unique insight into the challenges and triumphs of those who serve our communities.
Buy Ticket
Our Vision
Educating the Public
The museum aims to foster understanding and appreciation of law enforcement through engaging educational experiences like the Irish Connection digital exhibit.
Inspiring Generations
We hope to inspire the next generation of officers, leaders and citizens by showcasing the dedication, innovation and bravery of law enforcement professionals.
Building Connections
Our vision is to create a space where the public and law enforcement can connect; building mutual respect and understanding for a safer and stronger community.
Who Are the United States Law Enforcement Foundation?
The United States Law Enforcement Foundation (USLEF) is dedicated to supporting law enforcement officers, their families and the wider community. In addition to overseeing the American Police Hall of Fame and Museum, USLEF offers multiple programs such as The Hope Initiative to support officers’ children, provide emotional and financial support for families of fallen officers or those disabled in the line of duty. The USLEF wider programs promote public safety, and inspire the next generation of law enforcement. Together, we’re building a brighter future for the men and women who serve and protect our country. To learn more about the impact USLEF are having go to
uslef.org.
To learn more about the Police Family Survivors Fund go to
afp-cc.org
.
Donate
Friends of Law Enforcement
Museum activities are sponsored, in part, by the Brevard County Board of County Commissioners, the Florida’s Space Coast Office of Tourism and The Brevard.
Stay in Touch
Stay Connected
